tagline: Makes complex systems visible through precise, well-typed Mermaid.js diagrams that live alongside code and documentation.
pros: Fluent in all Mermaid.js diagram types — picks the right one for the information
Diagrams as code: version-controlled, maintainable, embedded in documentation
Excellent at choosing the right abstraction level for the audience
Creates visual conventions that make diagram sets consistent and learnable
cons: Limited to text-based diagramming — complex visual designs need handoff to designers
Can't resolve architectural disagreements, only visualize them
Mermaid has layout limitations for very complex systems

model_recommendations.notes: Template-following, scheduling, tracking, simple Q&A. Lightweight models save cost without sacrificing quality for these structured tasks.
